intro: Podanthum strigillosum, commonly known as the velvetleaf. It is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Asia, characterized by its hairy, ovate leaves and clusters of small, pale yellow flowers. The plant belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in disturbed soils. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological studies and ornamental gardening.
